lessons.title: Lesson 1: Introduction to Polynomials (Terms, Coefficients, Degree)

games.name: Polynomial Term Identifier
games.implementationDetails: Present algebraic expressions. Ask the player to identify terms, coefficients, and the constant term. Use input fields or multiple-choice options. Provide clear feedback and explanations.
learningPoints: Definition of Terms in a Polynomial

games.name: Polynomial Degree Sorter
games.implementationDetails: Use a drag-and-drop interface. Present polynomial expressions. Ask the player to sort them by degree (linear, quadratic, cubic, etc.). Check the highest power of the variable. Provide visual feedback.
learningPoints: Definition of Degree of a Polynomial

games.name: Polynomial Builder
games.implementationDetails: Provide input fields for coefficients and exponents. Allow the player to build a polynomial expression. Validate the input (e.g., whole number exponents). Display the resulting polynomial.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Types of Polynomials (Linear, Quadratic, Cubic, Monomial, Binomial, Trinomial)

games.name: Polynomial Type Match
games.implementationDetails: Use a matching game format (card flipping). Present polynomials and their types (linear, quadratic, cubic, monomial, etc.). Check if the player correctly matches the polynomial to its type.

games.name: Polynomial Classification Quiz
games.implementationDetails: Present multiple-choice questions that ask the player to classify a given polynomial (e.g., 'Which of the following is a binomial?'). Store the questions in a data structure. Check the answer and provide feedback.

games.name: Build a polynomial
games.implementationDetails: Present a polynomial type and ask students to construct a polynomial fitting the description

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Zeroes of a Polynomial (Finding Zeroes, Relationship with Coefficients)

games.name: Polynomial Zero Finder
games.implementationDetails: Present linear and simple quadratic polynomials. Use input fields for the player to enter a value for x. Check if p(x) = 0. Provide feedback. Add hints related to coefficients if user is stuck.
learningPoints: Definition of a Zero of a Polynomial
Finding Zeroes of Quadratic Polynomials (simple cases)

games.name: Is it a zero?
games.implementationDetails: Present a polynomial and some values for the variable. Ask the student to identify the values that are zeroes for the given polynomial
learningPoints: Definition of a Zero of a Polynomial

games.name: Value predictor
games.implementationDetails: Present a zero and ask students to select the factor that will have this zero

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Factorization of Polynomials (Factor Theorem, Splitting Middle Term)

games.name: Factor Theorem Checker
games.implementationDetails: Present a polynomial p(x) and a linear expression (x-a). Ask student if (x-a) is a factor using the Factor Theorem (check if p(a)=0). Provide steps hint based factorization

games.name: Middle Term Splitter
games.implementationDetails: For quadratic polynomials, guide the player through splitting the middle term. Use input fields to select factors of coefficients c. Check if the player splits it correctly. Guide with hints for factor selection.

games.name: Factor constructor
games.implementationDetails: Present the factors of expression and ask student to identify the expression this would result in

lessons.title: Lesson 5: Algebraic Identities (Expanding and Factorizing Expressions)

games.name: Identity Match
games.implementationDetails: Use a card matching game format. Present identities and their expansions/factorizations. Match left-hand side with correct right-hand side. Feedback and scoring system.

games.name: Missing Term Identifier
games.implementationDetails: Display an identity with a missing term (e.g., (a + b)² = a² + ___ + b²). Multiple-choice options for the missing term. Check the player's selection.

games.name: Expression simplifier
games.implementationDetails: Present an expression that can be simplified using identity and ask students to simplify it using a specific identity by manipulating expression with mouse drag and drop
